value: Morning Prayer

value.label: Confession of Sin
value: Dearly beloved, we have come together in the presence of Almighty God our heavenly Father, to render thanks for the great benefits that we have received at his hands, to set forth his most worthy praise, to hear his holy Word, and to ask, for ourselves and on behalf of others, those things that are necessary for our life and our salvation. And so that we may prepare ourselves in heart and mind to worship him, let us kneel in silence, and with penitent and obedient hearts confess our sins, that we may obtain forgiveness by his infinite goodness and mercy.
Let us humbly confess our sins unto Almighty God.
value.label: Confession of Sin

value: Silence may be kept.
Officiant and People together, all kneeling

Almighty and most merciful Father,
we have erred and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep,
we have followed too much the devices and desires of our own hearts,
we have offended against thy holy laws,
we have left undone those things which we ought to have done,
and we have done those things which we ought not to have done.
But thou, O Lord, have mercy upon us,
spare thou those who confess their faults,
restore thou those who are penitent,
according to thy promises declared unto mankind
in Christ Jesus our Lord;
and grant, O most merciful Father, for his sake,
that we may hereafter live a godly, righteous, and sober life,
to the glory of thy holy Name.
The Almighty and merciful Lord grant us absolution and remission of all our sins, true repentance, amendment of life, and the grace and consolation of his Holy Spirit.
The Almighty and merciful Lord grant you absolution and remission of all your sins, true repentance, amendment of life, and the grace and consolation of his Holy Spirit.
Invitatory and Psalter
All stand

value.label: Officiant
value.text: O Lord, open thou our lips.
And our mouth shall show forth thy praise.
value.label: People

value: Alleluia.

value.halfverse: therefore let us keep the feast,
value.verse:
Alleluia.
Christ our Passover is sacrificed for us; *

Not with old leaven,
neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness, *
value.halfverse: but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. Alleluia.
death hath no more dominion over him.
value.verse: Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; *

value.halfverse: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.
value.verse: For in that he died, he died unto sin once; *

value.halfverse: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, *
value.verse: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, *
Christ is risen from the dead, *
value.halfverse: and become the first fruits of them that slept.
by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
value.verse: For since by man came death, *
For as in Adam all die, *
value.halfverse: even so in Christ shall all be made alive. Alleluia.

value.verse: O come, let us sing unto the Lord; *
value.halfverse: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

value.verse: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.
and a great King above all gods.
value.verse: For the Lord is a great God, *
In his hand are all the corners of the earth, *
value.halfverse: and the strength of the hills is his also.
and his hands prepared the dry land.
value.verse: The sea is his, and he made it, *
O come, let us worship and fall down, *
value.halfverse: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

and we are the people of his pasture
and the sheep of his hand.
value.verse: For he is the Lord our God, *
O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness; *
value.halfverse: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

and with righteousness to judge the world
and the peoples with his truth.
value.verse: For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth, *

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.

value.verse: Be joyful in the Lord, all ye lands; *
value.halfverse:
serve the Lord with gladness
and come before his presence with a song.

value.verse:
Be ye sure that the Lord he is God;
it is he that hath made us and not we ourselves; *
value.halfverse: we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.

value.verse:
O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving
and into his courts with praise; *
value.halfverse: be thankful unto him and speak good of his Name.

value.verse:
For the Lord is gracious;
his mercy is everlasting; *
value.halfverse: and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

value: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit: *
as it was in the beginning, is now, and will be for ever. Amen.
The Lessons
A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: The Word of the Lord.

value: A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: The Word of the Lord.
The Word of the Lord.

value: The Sermon

I believe in God, the Father almighty,
	maker of heaven and earth;
And in Jesus Christ his only Son our Lord;
	who was conceived by the Holy Ghost,
	born of the Virgin Mary,
	suffered under Pontius Pilate,
	was crucified, dead, and buried.
	He descended into hell.
	The third day he rose again from the dead.
	He ascended into heaven,
	and sitteth on the right hand of God the Father almighty.
	From thence he shall come to judge the quick and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Ghost,
	the holy catholic Church,
	the communion of saints,
	the forgiveness of sins,
	the resurrection of the body,
	and the life everlasting. Amen.
value.label: The Apostles’ Creed

value: The Prayers

value.label: Officiant
value.text: The Lord be with you.
And with thy spirit.
value.label: People

value.text: Let us pray.
value.label: Officiant

value:
Our Father, who art in heaven,
	hallowed be thy Name,
	thy kingdom come,
	thy will be done,
	on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread.
And forgive us our trespasses,
	as we forgive those
	who trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation,
	but deliver us from evil.
For thine is the kingdom,
	and the power, and the glory,
	for ever and ever.
value.label: The Lord’s Prayer
V.
value.text: O Lord, show thy mercy upon us;
And grant us thy salvation.
value.label: R.

value.text: Endue thy ministers with righteousness;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: And make thy chosen people joyful.

value.label: V.
value.text: Give peace, O Lord, in all the world;
For only in thee can we live in safety.
value.label: R.

value.text: Lord, keep this nation under thy care;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: And guide us in the way of justice and truth.

value.label: V.
value.text: Let thy way be known upon earth;
Thy saving health among all nations.
value.label: R.

value.text: Let not the needy, O Lord, be forgotten;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: Nor the hope of the poor be taken away.

value.label: V.
value.text: Create in us clean hearts, O God;
And sustain us with thy Holy Spirit.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: O Lord, save thy people and bless thine heritage;

value.label: R.
value.text: Govern them and lift them up for ever.
Day by day we magnify thee;
value.label: V.

value.text: And we worship thy name for ever, world without end.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Vouchsafe, O Lord, to keep us this day without sin;
O Lord, have mercy upon us, have mercy upon us.
value.label: R.

value.text: O Lord, let thy mercy be upon us;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: As our trust is in thee.

value.label: V.
value.text: O Lord, in thee have I trusted;

value.label: R.
value.text: Let me never be confounded.

value: Almighty God, whose most dear Son went not up to joy but first he suffered pain, and entered not into glory before he was crucified: Mercifully grant that we, walking in the way of the cross, may find it none other than the way of life and peace; through the same thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: A Collect for Fridays
A Collect for Saturdays
value: Almighty God, who after the creation of the world didst rest from all thy works and sanctify a day of rest for all thy creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of thy sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to thy people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

value.label: A Collect for Sundays
value: O God, who makest us glad with the weekly remembrance of the glorious resurrection of thy Son our Lord: Grant us this day such blessing through our worship of thee, that the days to come may be spent in thy favor; through the same Jesus Christ our Lord.
The Sermon
Here may be sung a hymn or anthem.
Authorized intercessions and thanksgivings may follow.
Before the close of the Office one or both of the following may be used

Almighty God, Father of all mercies,
we thine unworthy servants
do give thee most humble and hearty thanks
for all thy goodness and loving-kindness
to us and to all men.
We bless thee for our creation, preservation,
and all the blessings of this life;
but above all for thine inestimable love
in the redemption of the world by our Lord Jesus Christ;
for the means of grace, and for the hope of glory.

And, we beseech thee,
give us that due sense of all thy mercies,
that our hearts may be unfeignedly thankful;
and that we show forth thy praise,
not only with our lips, but in our lives,
by giving up our selves to thy service,
and by walking before thee
in holiness and righteousness all our days;
through Jesus Christ our Lord,
to whom, with thee and the Holy Ghost,
be all honor and glory, world without end.
value.label: The General Thanksgiving

value: Almighty God, who hast given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplication unto thee; and hast promised through thy well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name thou wilt be in the midst of them: Fulfill now, O Lord, the desires and petitions of thy servants as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of thy truth, and in the world to come life everlasting.
value.label: A Prayer of St. Chrysostom

value: Then may be said

value.text: Let us bless the Lord.

value.response: Thanks be to God. Alleluia, alleluia
value.text: Let us bless the Lord. Alleluia, alleluia.
